alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 3:37PM PST until January 29 at 12:14PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Tualatin River at Farmington affecting Washington County. Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Benton and Polk Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especiallly if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:10 PM PST Saturday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 27.5 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning to 18.3 feet early Thursday morning. It will rise to 18.9 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 600 AM PST.
